Class fuzzy.FuzzyEngine 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----fuzzy.FuzzyEngine
public class FuzzyEngine
extends Object
This class evaluates rules given by string variables. Evaluation is performed either on a single rule or a block of rules.

FuzzyEngine()
Constructor.

addHedge(Hedge)
Add a hedge (derived from engine.Hedge) to the engine
evaluateBlock(FuzzyBlockOfRules)
Evaluate block of rules (engine.FuzzyBlockOfRules)
evaluateRule(String)
Parse and evaluate a fuzzy rule in text form.
isRuleFired()
Returns "true" if a rule has fired during the last call to FuzzyEngine.evaluateRule(String).
parseRule(String)
Equivalent of FuzzyEngine.evaluateRule(String), but for the blocks of rules.
register(FuzzyBlockOfRules)
Register a block of rules with the engine.
register(LinguisticVariable)
Register a linguistic variable with the engine.
reset()
Reset all previously fired rules.

FuzzyEngine 
 public FuzzyEngine()
Constructor. Engine initialization is performed here.

addHedge 
 public void addHedge(Hedge hedge)
Add a hedge (derived from engine.Hedge) to the engine

Parameters:
hedge - Implementation of a hedge
evaluateBlock 
 public void evaluateBlock(FuzzyBlockOfRules block) throws EvaluationException
Evaluate block of rules (engine.FuzzyBlockOfRules)

Parameters:
block - An instance of engine.FuzzyBlockOfRules
evaluateRule 
 public String evaluateRule(String rule) throws RulesParsingException
Parse and evaluate a fuzzy rule in text form. Input values for the linguistic variables participating in the rule have to be set before calling this function. Call to FuzzyEngine.isRuleFired() will return "true" if the rule fired.

Parameters:
rule - String containing the rule
isRuleFired 
 public boolean isRuleFired()
Returns "true" if a rule has fired during the last call to FuzzyEngine.evaluateRule(String). If a block of rules has been evaluated, the function FuzzyBlockOfRules.isRuleFired() should be called instead.

Returns:
"True" if the last evaluated rules has fired, "false" if not.
parseRule 
 public FuzzyRule parseRule(String rule) throws RulesParsingException
Equivalent of FuzzyEngine.evaluateRule(String), but for the blocks of rules.

Parameters:
rule - Textual represenation of a fuzzy rule.
Returns:
parsedRule Parsed rule.
Throws: RulesParsingException
This exception is thrown if an error occurs during parsing. Exception.getMessage() will return the reason for error.
register 
 public void register(FuzzyBlockOfRules block)
Register a block of rules with the engine. Every block has to be registered before it can be parsed.

Parameters:
block - engine.FuzzyBlockOfRules to be registered.
register 
 public void register(LinguisticVariable function)
Register a linguistic variable with the engine. Any lingustic variable participating in fuzzy evaluations should be registered with the engine. The same lingustic variable cannot be registered with different engines if labels are used.

Parameters:
function - fuzzyEngine.LinguisticVariable to be registered with the engine.
reset 
 public void reset()
Reset all previously fired rules. Call to this function clears all rules and resets the engine to its initial state.
